00037 #include "egs_scoring.h"
00038 #include "egs_functions.h"
00039 
00040 #include <string>
00041 using std::string;
00042 
00043 EGS_ScoringArray::EGS_ScoringArray(int N) :
00044     current_ncase(0), current_ncase_65536(0), current_ncase_short(0) {
00045     if( N <= 0 ) egsFatal("EGS_ScoringArray::EGS_ScoringArray:\n"
00046          "   attempt to construct a scoring array with non-positive size\n");
00047     result = new EGS_ScoringSingle [N]; nreg = N;
00048 }
00049 
00050 EGS_ScoringArray::~EGS_ScoringArray() { delete [] result; }
00051 
00052 void EGS_ScoringArray::setHistory(EGS_I64 ncase) {
00053     if( ncase != current_ncase ) {
00054         current_ncase = ncase; EGS_I64 aux = ncase >> 16;
00055         if( aux != current_ncase_65536 ) {
00056             current_ncase_65536 = aux;
00057             for(int j=0; j<nreg; j++) result[j].finishCase(0,0);
00058         }
00059         aux = ncase - (aux << 16);
00060         unsigned short aux1 = (unsigned short) aux;
00061         current_ncase_short = aux1;
00062     }
00063 }
00064 
00065 void EGS_ScoringArray::reportResults(double norm, const char *title,
00066                 bool relative_error, const char *format) {
00067     if( title ) egsInformation("\n\n%s for %d particles:\n\n",title,
00068             current_ncase);
00069     if( current_ncase < 2 ) {
00070         egsWarning("EGS_ScoringArray::reportResults: you must run more than 2 "
00071                 "histories\n\n"); return;
00072     }
00073     char c = (relative_error) ? '%' : ' ';
00074     string myformat = "  %d    %g  +/-  %g %c\n";
00075     const char *oformat = format ? format : myformat.c_str();
00076     for(int j=0; j<nreg; j++) {
00077         double r,dr; result[j].currentResult(current_ncase,r,dr);
00078         if( relative_error ) dr = (r > 0) ? 100*dr/r : 100;
00079         else dr *= norm;
00080         egsInformation(oformat,j,r*norm,dr,c);
00081     }
00082 }
